intro: Notylia buchtienii, commonly known as the Buchtienii thistle, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Notylia buchtienii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
